message.content:
You are Maven Flow, an autonomous development agent.

## Your Task

1. Find the first incomplete story in the PRD files (docs/prd-*.json)
2. Implement that story completely
3. Update the PRD to mark it complete (set "passes": true)
4. Run tests: pnpm run typecheck
5. Commit: git add . && git commit -m "feat: [story-id] [description]" -m "Co-Authored-By: Next Mavens Flow <flow@nextmavens.com>"

## Completion Signal

When ALL stories are complete, output EXACTLY:
<promise>COMPLETE</promise>

## If Not Complete

Do NOT output the signal. Just end your response.

## Important: Output Formatting

- Use ASCII characters only - no Unicode symbols like checkmarks, arrows, etc.
- Use [OK] or [X] instead of checkmarks
- Use * or - for bullets instead of Unicode symbols
- Keep formatting simple and compatible with all terminals

     5→  "userStories": [
     6→    {
     7→      "id": "US-001",
     8→      "title": "Generate API Key",
     9→      "description": "As a project owner, I want to generate API keys so that my applications can authenticate.",

    11→        "Key format: nm_{32-char-base64}",
    12→        "Hash stored: SHA256(key)",
    13→        "Prefix stored: first 8 chars",

    15→        "Typecheck passes"

    21→        "step10": ["supabase"]
    22→      },
    23→      "priority": 1,
    24→      "passes": true,
    25→      "notes": "Implemented with POST /api/projects/:id/keys endpoint. Key format nm_{base64}, SHA256 hash stored, only shown once on creation."
    26→    },
    27→    {
    28→      "id": "US-002",
    29→      "title": "Validate API Key",

    31→      "acceptanceCriteria": [
    32→        "Middleware extracts Bearer token",
    33→        "Hashes token and compares to database",
    34→        "Checks key is_active",
    35→        "Checks expiration",
    36→        "Returns 401 if invalid",
    37→        "Typecheck passes"
    38→      ],
    39→      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
    40→      "mcpTools": {
    41→        "step1": ["supabase"],
    42→        "step7": ["supabase"],
    43→        "step10": ["supabase"]
    44→      },
    45→      "priority": 1,
    46→      "passes": true,
    47→      "notes": "Implemented with validateApiKey function that hashes token, checks is_active and expiration, returns null if invalid"
    48→    },
    49→    {
    50→      "id": "US-003",
    51→      "title": "List API Keys",
    52→      "description": "As a project owner, I want to see all API keys so that I can manage access.",
    53→      "acceptanceCriteria": [
    54→        "Shows name, prefix, scopes, last_used",
    55→        "Does NOT show full keys",

    58→        "Typecheck passes",
    59→        "Verify in browser"

    61→      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
    62→      "mcpTools": {},

    66→    },
    67→    {
    68→      "id": "US-004",
    69→      "title": "Revoke API Key",
    70→      "description": "As a project owner, I want to revoke keys so that I can disable compromised access.",
    71→      "acceptanceCriteria": [
    72→        "Sets is_active = false",
    73→        "Cannot be undone",
    74→        "Revoked keys immediately invalid",
    75→        "Audit log entry created",
    76→        "Typecheck passes",
    77→        "Verify in browser"
    78→      ],
    79→      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
    80→      "mcpTools": {
    81→        "step1": ["supabase"],
    82→        "step7": ["supabase"],

    93→      "acceptanceCriteria": [
    94→        "Scopes: read, write, admin",
    95→        "Keys checked against scope",
    96→        "Admin required for key management",
    97→        "Write required for mutations",
    98→        "Typecheck passes"
    99→      ],
   100→      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
   101→      "mcpTools": {},
   102→      "priority": 2,
   103→      "passes": true,
   104→      "notes": "Implemented with scopes stored on API key and hasApiKeyScope/hasAnyApiKeyScope helper functions"
   105→    },

{
  "project": "Platform Core (Supabase Foundation)",
  "branchName": "flow/platform-core",
  "description": "Self-host Supabase with Docker for the NextMavens Platform. Implement custom organizations to projects flow with database-per-app isolation, Supavisor connection pooling, and Kong API gateway routing.",
  "userStories": [
    {
      "id": "US-001",
      "title": "Create Organization",
      "description": "As a platform administrator, I want to create an organization so that I can group related projects and manage team access.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Organization has unique slug",
        "Creator is assigned owner role",
        "Organization record stored in master database",
        "API endpoint: POST /api/orgs with {name, slug?}",
        "Typecheck passes",
        "RLS policies enable org member access"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
      "mcpTools": {
        "step1": ["supabase"],
        "step7": ["supabase"],
        "step10": ["supabase"]
      },
      "priority": 1,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with POST /api/orgs endpoint, organizations table with RLS policies, and owner role assignment"
    },
    {
      "id": "US-002",
      "title": "Create Project with Database",
      "description": "As a platform administrator, I want to create a project within an organization so that it gets an isolated PostgreSQL database with unique credentials.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Project has unique slug within organization",
        "PostgreSQL database created: project_{uuid} (hyphens replaced with underscores)",
        "Database role created: app_{uuid}",
        "Random password generated and stored encrypted",
        "API keys generated (anon/service_role)",
        "Connection string returned",
        "Studio accessible via /studio/{slug}",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
      "mcpTools": {
        "step1": ["supabase"],
        "step7": ["supabase"],
        "step10": ["supabase"]
      },
      "priority": 1,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with POST /api/projects endpoint. Database creation via create_project_database SQL function. Studio routing via Kong pending Docker infrastructure setup."
    },
    {
      "id": "US-003",
      "title": "List Organizations",
      "description": "As a logged-in user, I want to see all organizations I belong to so that I can navigate to my projects.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Returns organizations where user is a member",
        "Includes user's role in each organization",
        "API endpoint: GET /api/orgs",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
      "mcpTools": {},
      "priority": 1,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with GET /api/orgs endpoint that returns organizations with user's role merged in"
    },
    {
      "id": "US-004",
      "title": "List Projects",
      "description": "As a logged-in user, I want to see all projects I have access to so that I can manage my applications.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Returns projects from user's organizations",
        "Filterable by organization_id and status",
        "API endpoint: GET /api/projects?org_id={id}",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
      "mcpTools": {},
      "priority": 1,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with GET /api/projects endpoint supporting org_id and status filters"
    },
    {
      "id": "US-005",
      "title": "Get Project Details",
      "description": "As a developer, I want to retrieve project details including API keys and database credentials so that I can configure my application.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Returns project metadata",
        "Returns WhatsApp instances",
        "Returns active API keys (without secrets)",
        "Returns project settings",
        "API endpoint: GET /api/projects/{id}",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
      "mcpTools": {},
      "priority": 2,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with GET /api/projects/:id returning project, whatsapp_instances, api_keys (without secrets), and settings"
    },
    {
      "id": "US-006",
      "title": "Supabase Studio Access",
      "description": "As a developer, I want to access Supabase Studio for my project so that I can visually manage my database.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Kong routes /studio/{slug} to Studio container",
        "Project database context injected via headers",
        "Authentication required",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
      "mcpTools": {},
      "priority": 2,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with /studio/[slug] page route and /api/studio/[slug] API endpoint. Route validates authentication and project access, fetches database credentials, and provides Studio access URL. Typecheck passes."
    },
    {
      "id": "US-007",
      "title": "Invite Organization Member",
      "description": "As an organization owner, I want to invite team members so that they can access projects.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Member receives invitation",
        "Role can be owner/admin/member/viewer",
        "Member can see organization after accepting",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7, 10],
      "mcpTools": {
        "step1": ["supabase"],
        "step7": ["supabase"],
        "step10": ["supabase"]
      },
      "priority": 2,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with POST /api/orgs/:id/members endpoint. Only owner/admin can invite members with specified role."
    },
    {
      "id": "US-008",
      "title": "Update Project Status",
      "description": "As an administrator, I want to suspend or archive projects so that I can manage unused applications.",
      "acceptanceCriteria": [
        "Status can be: provisioning/active/suspended/archived",
        "Suspended projects cannot receive API requests",
        "Database connections disabled when suspended",
        "Typecheck passes"
      ],
      "mavenSteps": [1, 7],
      "mcpTools": {},
      "priority": 3,
      "passes": true,
      "notes": "Implemented with PATCH /api/projects/:id endpoint allowing status updates by owner/admin"
    }
  ]
}

1→-- NextMavens Platform - Master Database Schema
     2→-- This schema manages organizations, projects, and their database credentials
     3→-- Run this on the master database to initialize the platform
     4→
     5→-- Enable required extensions
     6→CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";
     7→CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pgcrypto";
     8→CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pg_trgm";
     9→
    10→-- Custom types
    11→CREATE TYPE organization_role AS ENUM ('owner', 'admin', 'member', 'viewer');
    12→CREATE TYPE project_status AS ENUM ('provisioning', 'active', 'suspended', 'archived');
    13→CREATE TYPE whatsapp_instance_status AS ENUM ('pending', 'connecting', 'connected', 'disconnected', 'error');
    14→
    15→-- ====================================================================
    16→-- Organizations
    17→-- ====================================================================
    18→CREATE TABLE organizations (
    19→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    20→    name TEXT NOT NULL,
    21→    slug TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    22→    logo_url TEXT,
    23→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    24→    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
    25→);
    26→
    27→CREATE INDEX idx_organizations_slug ON organizations(slug);
    28→
    29→-- ====================================================================
    30→-- Organization Members
    31→-- ====================================================================
    32→CREATE TABLE organization_members (
    33→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    34→    organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    35→    user_id TEXT NOT NULL, -- Supabase Auth user ID
    36→    role organization_role NOT NULL DEFAULT 'member',
    37→    invited_by UUID,
    38→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    39→    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    40→    UNIQUE(organization_id, user_id)
    41→);
    42→
    43→CREATE INDEX idx_org_members_org_id ON organization_members(organization_id);
    44→CREATE INDEX idx_org_members_user_id ON organization_members(user_id);
    45→
    46→-- ====================================================================
    47→-- Projects
    48→-- ====================================================================
    49→CREATE TABLE projects (
    50→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    51→    organization_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES organizations(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    52→    name TEXT NOT NULL,
    53→    slug TEXT NOT NULL,
    54→    description TEXT,
    55→    status project_status NOT NULL DEFAULT 'provisioning',
    56→    db_name TEXT UNIQUE, -- Database name in PostgreSQL
    57→    db_user TEXT, -- Database role name
    58→    anon_key TEXT UNIQUE,
    59→    service_role_key TEXT UNIQUE,
    60→    jwt_secret TEXT,
    61→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    62→    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    63→    CONSTRAINT projects_org_slug_unique UNIQUE (organization_id, slug)
    64→);
    65→
    66→CREATE INDEX idx_projects_org_id ON projects(organization_id);
    67→CREATE INDEX idx_projects_slug ON projects(slug);
    68→CREATE INDEX idx_projects_status ON projects(status);
    69→
    70→-- ====================================================================
    71→-- Project Databases (Credentials Storage)
    72→-- ====================================================================
    73→CREATE TABLE project_databases (
    74→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    75→    project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    76→    db_name TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    77→    db_user TEXT NOT NULL,
    78→    db_password TEXT NOT NULL, -- Encrypted
    79→    db_host TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'db',
    80→    db_port INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 5432,
    81→    connection_pool TEXT DEFAULT 'supavisor',
    82→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    83→    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
    84→);
    85→
    86→CREATE INDEX idx_project_dbs_project_id ON project_databases(project_id);
    87→CREATE INDEX idx_project_dbs_db_name ON project_databases(db_name);
    88→
    89→-- ====================================================================
    90→-- Project Settings
    91→-- ====================================================================
    92→CREATE TABLE project_settings (
    93→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
    94→    project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    95→    key TEXT NOT NULL,
    96→    value JSONB NOT NULL,
    97→    description TEXT,
    98→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
    99→    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
   100→    UNIQUE(project_id, key)
   101→);
   102→
   103→CREATE INDEX idx_project_settings_project_id ON project_settings(project_id);
   104→
   105→-- ====================================================================
   106→-- WhatsApp Instances
   107→-- ====================================================================
   108→CREATE TABLE whatsapp_instances (
   109→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
   110→    project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   111→    instance_name TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   112→    instance_id TEXT, -- Evolution API instance ID
   113→    status whatsapp_instance_status NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
   114→    phone_number TEXT,
   115→    qr_code_base64 TEXT,
   116→    webhook_url TEXT,
   117→    webhook_secret TEXT,
   118→    settings JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
   119→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
   120→    connected_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
   121→    last_activity_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
   122→    UNIQUE(project_id, instance_name)
   123→);
   124→
   125→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_instances_project_id ON whatsapp_instances(project_id);
   126→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_instances_status ON whatsapp_instances(status);
   127→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_instances_instance_name ON whatsapp_instances(instance_name);
   128→
   129→-- ====================================================================
   130→-- WhatsApp Messages
   131→-- ====================================================================
   132→CREATE TABLE whatsapp_messages (
   133→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
   134→    instance_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES whatsapp_instances(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   135→    message_id TEXT NOT NULL,
   136→    from_number TEXT NOT NULL,
   137→    to_number TEXT NOT NULL,
   138→    message_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- text, image, audio, video, document
   139→    content TEXT,
   140→    media_url TEXT,
   141→    direction TEXT NOT NULL, -- inbound, outbound
   142→    status TEXT DEFAULT 'sent',
   143→    metadata JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
   144→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW(),
   145→    UNIQUE(instance_id, message_id)
   146→);
   147→
   148→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_messages_instance_id ON whatsapp_messages(instance_id);
   149→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_messages_from_number ON whatsapp_messages(from_number);
   150→CREATE INDEX idx_whatsapp_messages_created_at ON whatsapp_messages(created_at DESC);
   151→
   152→-- ====================================================================
   153→-- API Keys
   154→-- ====================================================================
   155→CREATE TABLE api_keys (
   156→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
   157→    project_id UUID NOT NULL REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   158→    name TEXT NOT NULL,
   159→    key_hash TEXT NOT NULL, -- SHA256 hash of the key
   160→    key_prefix TEXT NOT NULL, -- First 8 characters for identification
   161→    scopes TEXT[] NOT NULL DEFAULT ARRAY['read', 'write'],
   162→    is_active BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT true,
   163→    last_used_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
   164→    expires_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
   165→    created_by TEXT,
   166→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
   167→);
   168→
   169→CREATE INDEX idx_api_keys_project_id ON api_keys(project_id);
   170→CREATE INDEX idx_api_keys_key_hash ON api_keys(key_hash);
   171→CREATE INDEX idx_api_keys_active ON api_keys(is_active) WHERE is_active = true;
   172→
   173→-- ====================================================================
   174→-- Audit Logs
   175→-- ====================================================================
   176→CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
   177→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
   178→    project_id UUID REFERENCES projects(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
   179→    user_id TEXT,
   180→    action TEXT NOT NULL,
   181→    resource_type TEXT NOT NULL,
   182→    resource_id TEXT,
   183→    metadata JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
   184→    ip_address TEXT,
   185→    user_agent TEXT,
   186→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
   187→);
   188→
   189→CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_project_id ON audit_logs(project_id);
   190→CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_user_id ON audit_logs(user_id);
   191→CREATE INDEX idx_audit_logs_created_at ON audit_logs(created_at DESC);
   192→
   193→-- ====================================================================
   194→-- Storage Monitoring
   195→-- ====================================================================
   196→CREATE TABLE storage_metrics (
   197→    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuid_generate_v4(),
   198→    metric_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- disk_usage, docker_usage, etc.
   199→    value NUMERIC NOT NULL,
   200→    unit TEXT NOT NULL, -- GB, MB, percentage
   201→    threshold_alerted NUMERIC[] DEFAULT ARRAY[80, 90, 95],
   202→    metadata JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
   203→    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW()
   204→);
   205→
   206→CREATE INDEX idx_storage_metrics_type ON storage_metrics(metric_type);
   207→CREATE INDEX idx_storage_metrics_created_at ON storage_metrics(created_at DESC);
   208→
   209→-- ====================================================================
   210→-- Functions
   211→-- ====================================================================
   212→
   213→-- Function to generate a safe database name from project ID
   214→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_db_name(project_id UUID)
   215→RETURNS TEXT AS $$
   216→BEGIN
   217→    RETURN 'project_' || REPLACE(project_id::TEXT, '-', '_');
   218→END;
   219→$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql IMMUTABLE;
   220→
   221→-- Function to generate a safe database role name
   222→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_db_role(project_id UUID)
   223→RETURNS TEXT AS $$
   224→BEGIN
   225→    RETURN 'app_' || REPLACE(project_id::TEXT, '-', '_');
   226→END;
   227→$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql IMMUTABLE;
   228→
   229→-- Function to generate API key
   230→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION generate_api_key()
   231→RETURNS TEXT AS $$
   232→    SELECT encode(gen_random_bytes(32), 'base64');
   233→$$ LANGUAGE sql SECURITY DEFINER;
   234→
   235→-- Function to hash API key
   236→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION hash_api_key(key TEXT)
   237→RETURNS TEXT AS $$
   238→    SELECT encode(digest(key, 'sha256'), 'hex');
   239→$$ LANGUAGE sql IMMUTABLE;
   240→
   241→-- Function to create project database (admin only)
   242→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION create_project_database(project_id UUID)
   243→RETURNS JSONB AS $$
   244→DECLARE
   245→    v_db_name TEXT;
   246→    v_role_name TEXT;
   247→    v_password TEXT;
   248→    v_project projects;
   249→BEGIN
   250→    -- Get project details
   251→    SELECT * INTO v_project FROM projects WHERE id = project_id;
   252→    IF NOT FOUND THEN
   253→        RAISE EXCEPTION 'Project not found';
   254→    END IF;
   255→
   256→    -- Generate database name and role
   257→    v_db_name := generate_db_name(project_id);
   258→    v_role_name := generate_db_role(project_id);
   259→    v_password := encode(gen_random_bytes(24), 'base64');
   260→
   261→    -- Create database
   262→    EXECUTE format('CREATE DATABASE %I', v_db_name);
   263→
   264→    -- Connect to new database and create role
   265→    EXECUTE format('CREATE ROLE %I WITH LOGIN PASSWORD %L', v_role_name, v_password);
   266→
   267→    -- Grant privileges
   268→    EXECUTE format('GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE %I TO %I', v_db_name, v_role_name);
   269→
   270→    -- Store credentials
   271→    INSERT INTO project_databases (project_id, db_name, db_user, db_password)
   272→    VALUES (project_id, v_db_name, v_role_name, v_password);
   273→
   274→    -- Update project
   275→    UPDATE projects
   276→    SET db_name = v_db_name,
   277→        db_user = v_role_name,
   278→        status = 'active'
   279→    WHERE id = project_id;
   280→
   281→    RETURN jsonb_build_object(
   282→        'db_name', v_db_name,
   283→        'db_user', v_role_name,
   284→        'connection_string', format('postgres://%I:%s@db:5432/%I', v_role_name, v_password, v_db_name)
   285→    );
   286→END;
   287→$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql SECURITY DEFINER;
   288→
   289→-- Trigger to update updated_at
   290→CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_updated_at()
   291→RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
   292→BEGIN
   293→    NEW.updated_at = NOW();
   294→    RETURN NEW;
   295→END;
   296→$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;
   297→
   298→-- Apply updated_at trigger
   299→CREATE TRIGGER organizations_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON organizations
   300→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   301→
   302→CREATE TRIGGER organization_members_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON organization_members
   303→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   304→
   305→CREATE TRIGGER projects_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON projects
   306→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   307→
   308→CREATE TRIGGER project_databases_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON project_databases
   309→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   310→
   311→CREATE TRIGGER project_settings_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON project_settings
   312→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   313→
   314→CREATE TRIGGER whatsapp_instances_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON whatsapp_instances
   315→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   316→
   317→CREATE TRIGGER api_keys_updated_at BEFORE UPDATE ON api_keys
   318→    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at();
   319→
   320→-- ====================================================================
   321→-- Row Level Security (RLS)
   322→-- ====================================================================
   323→
   324→-- Enable RLS on sensitive tables
   325→ALTER TABLE organizations ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   326→ALTER TABLE organization_members ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   327→ALTER TABLE projects ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   328→ALTER TABLE project_databases ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   329→ALTER TABLE project_settings ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   330→ALTER TABLE whatsapp_instances ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   331→ALTER TABLE whatsapp_messages ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   332→ALTER TABLE api_keys ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   333→ALTER TABLE audit_logs ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;
   334→
   335→-- Organizations: accessible to members
   336→CREATE POLICY "Users can view organizations they are members of"
   337→    ON organizations FOR SELECT
   338→    USING (
   339→        EXISTS (
   340→            SELECT 1 FROM organization_members
   341→            WHERE organization_members.organization_id = organizations.id
   342→            AND organization_members.user_id = (current_setting('request.jwt.claim.user_id', true))
   343→        )
   344→    );
   345→
   346→-- Projects: accessible to org members
   347→CREATE POLICY "Users can view projects in their organizations"
   348→    ON projects FOR SELECT
   349→    USING (
   350→        EXISTS (
   351→            SELECT 1 FROM organization_members
   352→            WHERE organization_members.organization_id = projects.organization_id
   353→            AND organization_members.user_id = (current_setting('request.jwt.claim.user_id', true))
   354→        )
   355→    );
   356→
   357→-- WhatsApp instances: accessible to project members
   358→CREATE POLICY "Users can view WhatsApp instances in their projects"
   359→    ON whatsapp_instances FOR SELECT
   360→    USING (
   361→        EXISTS (
   362→            SELECT 1 FROM projects p
   363→            JOIN organization_members om ON om.organization_id = p.organization_id
   364→            WHERE p.id = whatsapp_instances.project_id
   365→            AND om.user_id = (current_setting('request.jwt.claim.user_id', true))
   366→        )
   367→    );
   368→
   369→-- Messages: accessible to project members
   370→CREATE POLICY "Users can view messages in their projects"
   371→    ON whatsapp_messages FOR SELECT
   372→    USING (
   373→        EXISTS (
   374→            SELECT 1 FROM whatsapp_instances wi
   375→            JOIN projects p ON p.id = wi.project_id
   376→            JOIN organization_members om ON om.organization_id = p.organization_id
   377→            WHERE wi.id = whatsapp_messages.instance_id
   378→            AND om.user_id = (current_setting('request.jwt.claim.user_id', true))
   379→        )
   380→    );
   381→
   382→-- ====================================================================
   383→-- Initial Data
   384→-- ====================================================================
   385→
   386→-- Insert default project settings
   387→INSERT INTO project_settings (project_id, key, value, description) VALUES

input.command:
git add . && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat: US-004 Send WhatsApp Message

Implemented POST /api/whatsapp/send endpoint with:

- API endpoint accepting {instance_name, project_id, number, text, media_url?}
- Instance validation to ensure instance belongs to project
- Connection status check to ensure instance is connected before sending
- Phone number formatting to WhatsApp format
- Integration with Evolution API:
  - POST /message/sendText/{instanceName} for text messages
  - POST /message/sendMedia/{instanceName} for media messages
- Message storage in whatsapp_messages table with direction='outbound'
- Database access layer for WhatsApp messages CRUD operations

Files created:
- dashboard/src/app/api/whatsapp/send/route.ts
- dashboard/src/lib/db/whatsapp-messages.ts

Typecheck passes.

Co-Authored-By: Next Mavens Flow <flow@nextmavens.com>
EOF
)"
